paragraph: CHAPTER IV. LATE FOR BREAKFAST.
tokens: late breakfast

paragraph: I AWOKE very early in the morning, just as it was daylight, and being unable to get to sleep again amid my strange surroundings, I arose and crept down-stairs as noiselessly as possible, intending to go for a long walk before breakfast.
tokens: awoke morning daylight unable get sleep strange surroundings arise creep stair possible intend go long walk breakfast

paragraph: At the bottom of the stairs I came upon a strange-looking white object, which, upon closer inspection, turned out to be the Pelican, asleep on the floor.
tokens: bottom stair come strange look white object close inspection turn asleep floor

paragraph: He was not sleeping as any respectable bird would have done, with his head tucked under his wing; but was lying stretched out on a rug in the hall, with his head resting on a cushion. His enormous beak was wide open, and he was snoring violently, and muttering uneasily in his sleep.
tokens: sleep respectable bird do head tuck wing lie stretch rug hall head rest cushion enormous beak wide open snore mutter sleep

paragraph: [THE PELICAN WAS SNORING VIOLENTLY.]
tokens: snoring

paragraph: I did not disturb him for fear lest he should make a noise; but hurrying past him I made my way to the hall door, which after a little difficulty I succeeded in unfastening. An ancient-looking turtle with a white apron was busily cleaning the steps, and started violently as I made my appearance at the door.
tokens: disturb fear make noise hurry make way hall door little difficulty succeed unfasten ancient look turtle white apron clean step start make appearance door

paragraph: “Bless my shell and fins!” he muttered; “what’s the creature wandering about this time of the morning for; they’ll be getting up in the middle of the night next. Just mind where you’re treading, please!” he called out. “The steps have been cleaned, and I don’t want to have to do them all over again.”
tokens: bless shell fin mutter creature wonder time morning get middle night mind tread call step clean want have do

paragraph: I managed to get down without doing much damage, and then remarked pleasantly:
tokens: manage get do much damage remark

paragraph: “Good morning; have you——”
tokens: good morning

paragraph: “No, I haven’t,” interrupted the Turtle snappishly; “and what’s more, I don’t want to.”
tokens: interrupt more want

paragraph: “What do you mean?” I inquired, in surprise.
tokens: mean inquire surprise

paragraph: “Soap!” was the reply.
tokens: soap reply

paragraph: “I don’t understand you,” I exclaimed.
tokens: understand exclaim

paragraph: “You’re an advertisement for somebody’s soap, aren’t you?” asked the Turtle.
tokens: advertisement soap ask

paragraph: “Certainly not,” I replied, indignantly.
tokens: reply

paragraph: “Your first remark sounded very much like it,” said the Turtle suspiciously. “‘Good morning, have you used——’”
tokens: first remark sound say good morning use

paragraph: “I wasn’t going to say that at all,” I interrupted. “I was merely going to ask if you could oblige me with a light.”
tokens: go say interrupt go ask oblige light

paragraph: “Oh, that’s another thing entirely,” said the Turtle, handing me some matches from his waistcoat pocket, and accepting a cigarette in return. “But really we have got so sick of those advertisement catchwords since the Doctor-in-Law returned from London with agencies for all sorts of things, that we hate the very sound of them. We are continually being told to ‘Call a spade a spade,’ which will be ‘grateful and comforting’ to ‘an ox in a teacup’ who is ‘worth a guinea a box,’ and who ‘won’t be happy till he gets it.’”
tokens: thing say hand match waistcoat pocket accept cigarette return get sick advertisement catchword return agency sort thing hate very sound tell call spade spade grateful comforting ox teacup worth guinea box happy get

paragraph: “It must be very trying,” I murmured sympathetically.
tokens: try murmure

paragraph: “Oh, it is,” remarked the Turtle. “Well,” he continued in a business-like tone, “I’m sorry you can’t stop—good morning.”
tokens: remark continue business tone sorry stop good morning

paragraph: “I didn’t say anything about going,” I ejaculated.
tokens: say go ejaculate

paragraph: “Oh, didn’t you? Well, I did then,” said the Turtle emphatically. “Move on, please!”
tokens: say move

paragraph: “You’re very rude,” I remarked.
tokens: rude remark

paragraph: “Think so?” said the Turtle pleasantly. “That’s all right then—good-by,” and he flopped down on his knees and resumed his scrubbing.
tokens: think say right good flop knee resume scrubbing

paragraph: [THE TURTLE FLOPPED DOWN ON HIS KNEES AND RESUMED HIS SCRUBBING.]
tokens: turtle flopped knees resume scrubbing

paragraph: There was nothing for me to do but to walk on, and seeing a quaint-looking old rose garden in the distance, I decided to go over and explore.
tokens: be do walk see quaint look old rose garden distance decide go explore

paragraph: I was walking slowly along the path leading to it, when I heard a curious clattering noise behind me, and turning around I beheld the Troubadour, still in his armor, dragging a large standard rosebush along the ground.
tokens: walk path lead hear curious clatter noise turn beheld armor drag large standard rosebush ground

paragraph: “As if it were not enough,” he grumbled, “to be maltreated as I am every night, without having all this trouble every morning. I declare it is enough to make you throw stones at your grandfather.”
tokens: enough grumble maltreat night have trouble morning declare enough make throw stone grandfather

paragraph: “What’s the matter?” I ventured to ask of the little man.
tokens: matter venture ask little man

paragraph: “Matter?” was the reply. “Why, these wretched rosebushes, they _will_ get out their beds at night, and wander about. I happened to leave the gate open last night, and this one got out, and goodness knows where he would have been by this time if I hadn’t caught him meandering about near the Palace.”
tokens: matter reply wretch rosebushe get bed night wander happen leave gate open last night one get goodness know time catch meander

paragraph: “Why! I’ve never heard of such a thing as a rosebush walking about,” I exclaimed in surprise.
tokens: hear thing rosebush walk exclaim surprise

paragraph: [“IN YOU GO!”]
tokens: go

paragraph: “Never heard of a——. Absurd!” declared the Troubadour, incredulously. “Of course they do. That’s what you have hedges and fences around the gardens for, isn’t it? Why, you can’t have been in a garden at night-time, or you wouldn’t talk such nonsense. All the plants are allowed to leave their beds at midnight. They are expected to be back again by daylight, though, and not go wandering about goodness knows where like this beauty,” and he shook the rosebush violently.
tokens: hear absurd declare course have hedge fence garden garden night time talk such nonsense plant allow leave bed midnight expect daylight go wonder goodness know beauty shake rosebush

paragraph: “In you go,” he continued, digging a hole with the point of his mailed foot, and sticking the rosebush into it.
tokens: go continue digg hole point mail foot stick rosebush

paragraph: “Hullo!” he exclaimed, going up to another one, at the foot of which were some broken twigs and crumpled leaves. “You’ve been fighting, have you? I say, it’s really too bad!”
tokens: exclaim go one foot break twig crumple leave fight say bad

paragraph: “But what does it matter to you?” I inquired. “It’s very sad, no doubt, but I don’t see why you should upset yourself so greatly about it.”
tokens: matter inquire sad doubt see upset

paragraph: “Well, you see,” was the reply, “I’m the head gardener here as well as Troubadour, and so am responsible for all these things. I do troubing as an extra,” he explained. “Three shillings a week and my armor. Little enough, isn’t it, considering the risk?”
tokens: see reply head gardener responsible thing troub extra explain shilling week armor little consider risk

paragraph: “Well, the office certainly does not seem overpopular, judging from last night,” I laughed. “Who were you serenading?”
tokens: office seem overpopular judge last night laugh serenade

paragraph: “Oh, any one,” was the reply. “I give it to them in turns. If any one offends me in the daytime I pay them out at night, see?
tokens: one reply give turn one offend daytime pay night see

paragraph: “I serenaded the Sister-in-Law mostly, but I shall give that up. She doesn’t play fair. I don’t mind people shying things at me in the least, for you see I’m pretty well protected; but when it comes to chivying me round the garden with a pair of tongs, it’s more than I bargained for. Look out! Here comes the Wallypug,” he continued.
tokens: serenade give play fair mind person shy thing least see protect come chivy garden pair tong more bargain look come continue

paragraph: Sure enough his Majesty was walking down the path, attended by A. Fish, Esq., who was wearing a cap and gown and carrying a huge book.
tokens: walk path attend wear cap gown carry huge book

paragraph: “Ah! good morning—good morning,” cried his Majesty, hurrying towards me. “I’d no idea you were out and about so early. I’m just having my usual morning lesson.”
tokens: good morning good morning cry hurry idea have usual morning lesson

paragraph: “Yes,” said A. Fish, Esq., smiling, and offering me a fin. “Ever sidse I god rid of by cold I’ve been teaching the Wallypug elocutiod. We have ad ‘our every bordig before breakfast, ad he’s geddig on spledidly.”
tokens: say smile offer fin god rid cold teach elocutiod have ad bordig breakfast ad geddig

paragraph: “I’m sure his Majesty is to be congratulated on having so admirable an instructor,” I remarked, politely, if not very truthfully.
tokens: sure congratulate have admirable instructor remark

tokens: walk path attend wear cap gown carry huge book page

paragraph: “Thags,” said A. Fish, Esq., looking very pleased. “I say, Wallypug, recide that liddle thig frob Richard III., jusd to show hib how well you cad do id, will you? You doe thad thig begiddidg ’Ad ’orse, ad ’orse, by kigdob for ad ’orse.’”

paragraph: “Yes, go on, Wallypug!” chimed in the Troubadour, indulgently.
tokens: go chime

paragraph: “Oh, I don’t know,” said his Majesty, simpering nervously. “I’m afraid I should break down.”

paragraph: “Doe you wondt, doe you wondt,” said A. Fish, Esq. “Cub alog, try id.”
tokens: wond wond say alog try id

paragraph: So his Majesty stood up, with his hands folded in front of him, and was just about to begin, when a bell in a cupola on the top of the palace began to ring violently.
tokens: stand hand fold front about begin bell cupola top palace begin ring

paragraph: “Good gracious, the breakfast bell! We shall be late,” cried the Wallypug, anxiously grasping my hand and beginning to run towards the palace.
tokens: good gracious breakfast bell late cry grasp hand begin run palace

paragraph: A. Fish, Esq., also shuffled along behind us as quickly as possible, taking three or four wriggling steps, and then giving a funny little hop with his tail, till, puffing and out of breath, we arrived at the palace just as the bell stopped ringing.
tokens: shuffle possible take wriggling step give funny little hop tail puffing breath arrive palace bell stop ring

paragraph: His Majesty hastily rearranged his disordered crown, and led the way into the dining hall.
tokens: rearrang disordered crown lead way dining hall

paragraph: A turtle carrying a large dish just inside the door whispered warningly to the Wallypug as we entered, “Look out! You’re going to catch it,” and hurried away.
tokens: turtle carry large dish door whisper enter look go catch hurry

paragraph: A good many creatures were seated at the table which ran down the center of the room, and at the head of which his Majesty’s Sister-in-Law presided, with a steaming urn before her. The Doctor-in-Law occupied a seat near by, and I heard him remark:
tokens: good many creature seat table run center room head preside steam urn occupy seat hear remark

paragraph: “They are two minutes late, madame. I hope you are not going to overlook it,” to which the lady replied, grimly, “You leave that to me.”
tokens: minute late madame hope go overlook lady reply leave

paragraph: “Sit there,” she remarked coldly, motioning me to a vacant seat, and the Wallypug and A. Fish, Esq., subsided into the two other unoccupied chairs on the other side of the table.
